alert.note: Alert for Canyonlands, Natural Bridges; La Sal and Abajo Mountains; Southeast Utah (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 05 at 3:02PM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central San Juan County through 345 PM MST... At 301 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 18 miles west of White Mesa, or 18 miles southwest of Blanding, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central San Juan County. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 191 in Utah between mile markers 50 and 51. Utah 95 between mile markers 94 and 119. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Canyonlands, Natural Bridges; La Sal and Abajo Mountains; Southeast Utah
